posts.post_content:
When I first started looking these cards were three times older than I am. At this point they're only twice as old as me. I'm healthy but the prospect of facing the next "milestone" is uncomfortable. Please help to put me out these two sets to rest before people do so to me!! At least getting the SINGLE CARD I need to finish my first set would make a statement. :-) I'm most likely to overpay for the last card I need in a set.

missing first set:

Edwards

replacements (for trade or straight sale):

ryan (replace psa 3)
wood (downgrade from sgc 86)

missing second set (lower grade - minor wear & bd ok):

pettitt
temple
edwards
queckenberner
lablanche
cummings
f murphy
(duffy)
(boyton)
(slocum)

good sense of humor, good luck! This is maybe my favorite set
-Ed

Henry,
I have this one: 
[IMG]https://img.comc.com/i/MultiSport/1888/Allen--Ginters-The-Worlds-Champions-Second-Series---Tobacco-N43/BIED/Billy-Edwards.jpg?id=f29cdb45-8463-4342-a672-7a4255c84de2&size=zoom[/IMG]
[IMG]https://img.comc.com/i/MultiSport/1888/Allen--Ginters-The-Worlds-Champions-Second-Series---Tobacco-N43/BIED/Billy-Edwards.jpg?id=f29cdb45-8463-4342-a672-7a4255c84de2&size=zoom&side=back[/IMG]

PSA hammered it by giving it a Poor 1 for the light paper loss on the front (right side).  Send me a message if it fits in your set; I remember your top set being in higher grade condition.

I was planning to crack it out of PSA and resubmit because the card presents really nicely otherwise.
